title: Effect on E field of distance change

content.question: How will the component of the electric field at point P due to <math alttext="Q sub 1 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> change, if at all, if the distance between point P and <math alttext="Q sub 1 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is halved?

choices.label: The electric field will not change because the magnitude of the charge does not change.
The electric field will decrease by half because electric field strength is directly proportional to the distance.
The electric field will double because the electric field strength is inversely proportional to the distance.
The electric field will quadruple because the electric field strength is inversely proportional to the square of the distance.

content.answer: The electric field will quadruple because the electric field strength is inversely proportional to the square of the distance.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
